description: Cumulative counting sequence: method B (noun,adjective)-pairs with first term 3.
comments: Segments (generated as at A055168):  3; 3,1; 3,2,1,1; 3,3,1,3,2,1; ...Conjecture: every positive integer occurs.
example: Write 3, thus having 3 once, thus having 3 twice and 1 once, thus having 3 3 times and 1 3 times and 2 once, etc.
mathematica: s = {3}; Do[s = Flatten[{s, {#,Count[s, #]} & /@ DeleteDuplicates[s]}], {24}]; s (* Peter Moses, Mar 21 2013 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 27 2000
